alert.note: Alert for Callahan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 02 at 3:57PM CST until March 02 at 8:00PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST FOR EASTERN CALLAHAN...NORTHWESTERN BROWN AND NORTHERN COLEMAN COUNTIES... At 356 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Silver Valley, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Rowden around 415 PM CST. Cross Plains around 420 PM CST. Atwell around 425 PM CST. Putnam around 430 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Us- 283 Near The Coleman- Callahan County Line, Echo, Admiral, Lake Coleman and Hords Creek Reservoir. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 310 and 320. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
